comments.text:
¡Hola Gijs!

What should happen to this bug?

It would appear that on recent versions of Firefox the "Warn me when web sites try to redirect or reload the page" setting don't even exist anymore, sadly.

IHMO, this should come back and appear under "Permissions" in about:preferences#privacy

This is still annoys users to this day as I ended up here while trying to help a Firefox user with https://support.mozilla.org/questions/1279361

¡Gracias!
Alex

(In reply to alex_mayorga from comment #4)
> ¡Hola Gijs!
> 
> What should happen to this bug?
> 
> It would appear that on recent versions of Firefox the "Warn me when web sites try to redirect or reload the page" setting don't even exist anymore, sadly.

It was removed from the visible prefs because it can break sites and rarely does what people actually want. See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1365133#c260 .

> IHMO, this should come back and appear under "Permissions" in about:preferences#privacy
> 
> This is still annoys users to this day as I ended up here while trying to help a Firefox user with https://support.mozilla.org/questions/1279361

Well, this user, as far as I can tell from the Spanish fed through a machine translator, was not helped by the option because the site in question uses javascript reloads and not meta redirects. That's bug 220118 / bug 687300.

Really, the issue here is that we should have something that blocks redirects/reloads that happen without user interaction. But if we implemented that, pretty much none of that could use the code currently used for this pref, so I don't see the checkbox coming back.
